intro: Ancylostemon hekouensis, commonly known as the Hekou starfruit tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often grown for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
